channel.title: How to Run "Java is My Bitch's" Mac OSX Client
channel.description:
[b][size=22pt]How to run/start a Mac OSX Client.[/size][/b]
[i]Some people may have an error, Something about a Login thing or something like that. What people dont know is, they must update there Java or just simple drag & drop.[/i]
[b][u]Downloads:[/u][/b]
[b]Java Runtime:[/b] https://cds.sun.com/is-bin/INTERSHOP.enfinity/WFS/CDS-CDS_Developer-Site/en_US/-/USD/ViewProductDetail-Start?ProductRef=jre-6u16-oth-JPR@CDS-CDS_Developer
[b]508 Mac OSX Client (IP Changer by Java Is My Bitch):[/b] http://uppit.com/v/XZFPIE1G
[b][u]Step 1:[/u][/b] When you first download the Client Folder, your first thoughts are.. "Hey, why not just get this started with." Once your client loads up and if you see a error message like this: [code]Exception in thread "main" java.lang.UnsupportedClassVersionError: Bad version number in .class file at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass1(Native Method) at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass(ClassLoader.java:675) at java.security.SecureClassLoader.defineClass(SecureClassLoader.java:124) at java.net.URLClassLoader.defineClass(URLClassLoader.java:260) at java.net.URLClassLoader.access$100(URLClassLoader.java:56) at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(URLClassLoader.java:195) at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method) at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(URLClassLoader.java:188) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:316) at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Launcher.java:280) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:251) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClassInternal(ClassLoader.java:374) logout [/code]
The code basically means that your Java is outdated or its just not in the right order of versions.
[b][u]Step 2:[/u][/b] To fix this, You must do the following. Finder -> Applications -> Utilities -> Java -> Java Preferences
Once you double click Java Preferences a window should open up. [IMG]http://i34.tinypic.com/1h8lch.png[/img]
If you have updated your Java earlier, you may see the problem. You must re-order your Java Versions to something like this. [IMG]http://i37.tinypic.com/4kfmhc.png[/img]
All you do is just drag & drop. Simple.
[b][u]Step 3:[/u][/b] Now, time to test if everything worked. Goto your Client folder & Double click run. No errors shouldn't have showed up & a box asking for what IP you want to connect to should show up. [IMG]http://i33.tinypic.com/2ithjte.png[/img]
[b][u]Congratulations![/u][/b] Enjoy Playing 508 Servers on your mac! All credit goes to Java is My Bitch for making the client. I take only 10% Credit for figuring out how to fix this simple error.
[b][i]Credits:[/i][/b] NotoriouzBoi- 10% (For finding this simple error) Java is My Bitch- 90% (For creating this wonderful client)
To view his old post, please click here- http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,402045.msg2987005.html#msg2987005
There are many custom items you have to see!
Thanks for reading,
.NotoriouzBoi.

item.title: How to Run "Java is My Bitch's" Mac OSX Client
item.dc:creator: @NotoriouzBoi NotoriouzBoi
item.description:
@NotoriouzBoi wrote:

[size=22pt]How to run/start a Mac OSX Client.[/size]

Some people may have an error, Something about a Login thing or something like that. What people dont know is, they must update there Java or just simple drag & drop.

Downloads:

Java Runtime: https://cds.sun.com/is-bin/INTERSHOP.enfinity/WFS/CDS-CDS_Developer-Site/en_US/-/USD/ViewProductDetail-Start?ProductRef=jre-6u16-oth-JPR@CDS-CDS_Developer

508 Mac OSX Client (IP Changer by Java Is My Bitch): http://uppit.com/v/XZFPIE1G

Step 1:
When you first download the Client Folder, your first thoughts are… “Hey, why not just get this started with.”
Once your client loads up and if you see a error message like this:

Exception in thread "main" java.lang.UnsupportedClassVersionError: Bad version number in .class file at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass1(Native Method) at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass(ClassLoader.java:675) at java.security.SecureClassLoader.defineClass(SecureClassLoader.java:124) at java.net.URLClassLoader.defineClass(URLClassLoader.java:260) at java.net.URLClassLoader.access$100(URLClassLoader.java:56) at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(URLClassLoader.java:195) at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method) at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(URLClassLoader.java:188) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:316) at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Launcher.java:280) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:251) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClassInternal(ClassLoader.java:374) logout

The code basically means that your Java is outdated or its just not in the right order of versions.

Step 2:
To fix this, You must do the following.
Finder -> Applications -> Utilities -> Java -> Java Preferences

Once you double click Java Preferences a window should open up.

If you have updated your Java earlier, you may see the problem. You must re-order your Java Versions to something like this.

All you do is just drag & drop. Simple.

Step 3:
Now, time to test if everything worked. Goto your Client folder & Double click run.
No errors shouldn’t have showed up & a box asking for what IP you want to connect to should show up.

Congratulations!
Enjoy Playing 508 Servers on your mac! All credit goes to Java is My Bitch for making the client. I take only 10% Credit for figuring out how to fix this simple error.

Credits:
NotoriouzBoi- 10% (For finding this simple error)
Java is My Bitch- 90% (For creating this wonderful client)

To view his old post, please click here- http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,402045.msg2987005.html#msg2987005

There are many custom items you have to see!

Thanks for reading,

.NotoriouzBoi.
